result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian David-Storm Southall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ian David-Storm Southall is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ian David-Storm Southall was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Ian David-Storm Southall was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Order for Defendant to reimburse County for Court-appointed attorney fees paid by County 
s/BNB 06-02-17
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2017 at 11:15 am.
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Ian David-Storm Southall in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM27 and 16FO128, 16CT70, 16CT71, 16CT90, 16TR1441, 16TR1448, 16TR1808, 16TR1809, 16TR1810, 16TR1811, 16TR1812, 16TR1813 & 16TR1814 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2 in 16CM127, Ct. 1 in 16CT90 and Ct. 2 in 17CT21.  
16CT70 and 16CT71 to be dismissed.  Ct. 3 in 16CM127, Ct. 2 in 16CT90 and Counts 1, 3, 4, & 5 in 17CT21 to be dismissed.  The State also agrees to read-in an uncharged case from April 3, 2017.
Atty Johnson agrees  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.

  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 in 16CM127, Ct. 1 in 16CT90 and Ct. 2 in 17CT21. 
16CT70 and 16CT71 to be dismissed.  Ct. 3 in 16CM127, Ct. 2 in 16CT90 and Counts 1, 3, 4, & 5 in 17CT21 to be dismissed.  

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  16CM127, Ct. 1: Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge (completed today or tomorrow before 4:00pm)
bond to be applied

Ct. 2:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before June 2, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge (completed today or tomorrow before 4:00pm)

16CT90, Ct. 1:  Court orders 45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before June 2, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge  (completed today or tomorrow before 4:00pm)
bond to be applied

17CT21, Ct. 2:    Court orders 35 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report on or before June 2, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge  (completed today or tomorrow before 4:00pm)

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the remainding balances on each case:  $50.00/month commencing on May 1, 2017

16CT70 and 16CT71 to be dismissed.  Ct. 3 in 16CM127, Ct. 2 in 16CT90 and Counts 1, 3, 4, & 5 in 17CT21 to be dismissed.  
All other TR or FO tickets tracking will be dismissed.

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Cases 16CT70, 16CT71, 16CT90, 16CM127, 16FO128, 16TR1441, 16TR1448, 16TR1808, 16TR1809, 16TR1810, 16TR1811, 16TR1812, 16TR1813 and 16TR1814 are tracking

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CT70, 16CT71, 16CT90, 16CM127, 16FO128, 16TR1441, 16TR1448, 16TR1808, 16TR1809, 16TR1810, 16TR1811, 16TR1812, 16TR1813 & 16TR1814 tracking together w/16CM127:
Atty Johnson states that he spoke with his client yesterday and the matter is resolved; thinks there was some confusion as to why he isn't here.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Return date on April 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM27, 16FO128, 16CT70, 16CT71, 16CT90, 16TR1441, 16TR1448, 16TR1808, 16TR1809, 16TR1810, 16TR1811, 16TR1812, 16TR1813 & 16TR1814 tracking together:
Atty Johnson states that the matters are resolved but that involves the defendant getting a valid DL in which he needs more time.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued in all matters
  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CT70, 16CT71, 16CT90, 16TR1441, 16TR1448, 16TR1808, 16TR1809, 16TR1810, 16TR1811, 16TR1812, 16TR1813 & 16TR1814 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant also has two other cases that are set for later today, 16CM127 & 16FO128 in which Atty Johnson is not appointed on.  Atty Johnson states that is correct and asks that all the cases track together.

BY THE COURT:  All cases to track together including 16CM127 & 16FO128.
Court will  appoint Atty Johnson on 16CM127 & 16FO128.
Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on December 13, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Return date on January 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
16FO128 is tracking w/16CM127

Defendant Ian David-Storm Southall in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16FO128 tracking:
   Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial  Return date scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 09:15 am.
